revised_title: An Analysis of English Waters and the Formation of Minerals
tldr: The author analyzes the composition of English waters and identifies two types of salts found in them: green vitriol and nitre. They also discuss the formation of minerals through the process of crystallization and the role of natural springs in their growth. The author explains the relationship between the earthy contents, such as iron ore and limestone, and the saline contents of the waters, and how they contribute to the formation of minerals.
